attributes.action: Ensure patient safety by empowering the General Medical Council to test all  overseas trained doctors have the requisite knowledge of English.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Dear Prime Minister

Effective communication skills and proficiency in the spoken
    language of patients (English) in Britain should be a mandatory
    requirement for all  frontline health care professionals to
    deliver patient care safely. The ‘unlawful’ killing of David
    Gray from Cambridgeshire by a German GP (General Practitioner)
    Daniel Ubani is yet another example of lapses in our
    legislation failing to safeguard patient safety. The present  legislation
    allows the GMC (General Medical Council) to grant  EEA (
    European Economic Area) doctors registration without having to
    demonstrate their English language proficiency, thus very
    seriously compromising the patient care and safety in some
    instances.  I request the Prime Minister to implement  the
    recommendations made by the H M Coroner William Morris
    following the inquest of Mr Gray's death to review the European
    Union regulations which allow free movement of doctors and to
    establish a better system of assessment by the NHS (National
    Health Service) of overseas doctors' ability to work in the UK.

Thank you

(Please forward this e-petition to all your contacts without fail)
